reviews.sentence: Location is OK. Front desk staff is OKFod is horrible. I had breakfast and food quality and taste is poor. Dinner as well is poor. Sports teams took all tables and the place is crowded with them.

Although it was an older hotel the facilities were excellent and the price reflected that. The hotel arranged a car with driver at a very reasonable price. Smoking inside the hotel including the breakfast area and in the common area of a non smoking floor.

Getting tired. Attention to detail is lacking. Asked if stayed before answered no still no directions given to room breakfast internet etc which my colleague checking in did get earlier. In room kettle has incorrect plug for socket leaving customers to jamb things in socket to use kettle health n safety what. Think management need to be more involved.

Pool bar personnel. After recent changes to the pool bar staff it is with mixed emotions as the original staff have been promoted to other posts leaving the bar staff lacking the five star rating we clients expect with the exception of Nurul who is observant extremely polite professional and more accommodating in his quest to serve with a smile polite willing to advise his peers in the art of making the clients feel welcome that any ardent traveller would welcome. He is an asset to the Mariot group and is a pleasure to be acquainted to such a positive endearing person. Regard Ian Crookes spar member and frequent bar customers.

Clean comfortable and very friendly. The hotel is about 20 minutes by car from the new airport. It is very nice with an extremely helpful and friendly staff. It is worth asking for executive level which costs 20qr more per night as you have access to the lounge and can have breakfast and an evening snack at no extra cost. There are many restaurants in the hotel Indian Mexican steakhouse Italian Japanese. do not arrive with an empty credit card. All except the Italian charge huge prices for the meals and the alcohol prices are extortionate. Neverthes the quality is excellent. I consider it to be the best Indian food I have eaten outside of the uk. The room was well appointed. Mine was in the newer blue tower which gave me a very big room compared to my colleagues who were in the older tower. However with the smaller room they had a balcony which would have been good if the weather was warmer. The Doha bus tour starts at the Mariot which was very convenient for us. All in all a very good hotel.

Clean comfortable and very friendly. The hotel is about 20 minutes by car from the new airport. It is very nice with an extremely helpful and friendly staff. It is worth asking for executive level which costs 20qr more per night as you have access to the lounge and can have breakfast and an evening snack at no extra cost. There are many restaurants in the hotel Indian Mexican steakhouse Italian Japanese. do not arrive with an empty credit card. All except the Italian charge huge prices for the meals and the alcohol prices are extortionate. Neverthes the quality is excellent. I consider it to be the best Indian food I have eaten outside of the uk. The room was well appointed. Mine was in the newer blue tower which gave me a very big room compared to my colleagues who were in the older tower. However with the smaller room they had a balcony which would have been good if the weather was warmer. The Doha bus tour starts at the Mariot which was very convenient for us. All in all a very good hotel.

Excellent staff. but need taxis please. We chose this hotel because it is near the airport and we had a very early morning flight the following day. The hotel is large and well located with views of the Doha skyline however it is dated looking and definitely needs a renovation. The other negative is that getting a taxi is very difficult for some reason which I had also read in a previous review. We had to order the hotel car to return to the airport at 3 times the price of a taxi is the taxi scarcity situation real or manufactured. The excellent staff is very friendly and they upgraded us to a large suite on the 6th floor which was fantastic. There are several dining options too in the hotel which was great.

Disappointed. I have stayed in many Mariot hotels before this is easily the worst. Having read many reviews I was nervous about staying here. Reviews that go back to 2012 citing tired and worn out rooms have clearly not made any impact at Mariot management level The rooms are indeed tired and worn out 3 years later. nothing has been done. Broken flush on toilet sink plug that does not release. stains on carpet. shoddy TV reception. WiFI slow. breakfast poor beds very soft ripped and torn lamp shades used toiletries in bathroom. shower attachment faulty. I could go on. needless to say I wont be going back.

Maintenance it is not its strong point. There are two Mariots in Doha and this seems to run the second division. Strength. well located close to airport and despite of that quiet with a private beach and nice swimming pool. Weaknesses it requires some renovation mainly on bathrooms. Also internet only available in common areas you need to pay to have it in your room and they will not help you to book a reservation in a restaurant outside from hotel.

Family staycation Smoking allowed. We were given a lovely seafacing room and the weather was lovely. We were also given late check out which was great as the kids could have a swim before leaving and then get bathed and changed. We were not informed that the lounge to be used by the club rooms had specific mealtimes and it was not an open buffet. The lunch offering was very spare almost ascetic.

Good Mariot for quick stay. This is a very decent Mariot in Doha Good proximity to Airport great vire of downtown Doha Skyline. Rooms are quite comfortable and quiet. Nice pool area. Small private beach for a warm water night swim. Breakfast in room was quite good I recommend the traditional Arabic Breakfast. All in all good value for money.

amazing experience. Had dinner at the street food buffet which was recomended by a member of staff who is a friend. Mr Manish Bhatathey had an amazing spread from indian pani puri to the great american fish and chips with choices of drinks and desertsoveral i loved the experience as the staff made us comfortable and made sure our table was clear of used dishes often which is very important to medefinitely worth another visit.

Enjoyable experience. Definitely Up to Mariot standard Nice location But work happening around can make it noisyV friendly staff and u feel welcomed at the placeWil def stay there when ever visit doha. Good breakfast and eating optionsGod job.

Good value close to airport. Good location large rooms. We were traveling with my parents and arrived at 70am. Check in is at 40pm so we asked whether at least one room could be made available earlier expecting to freshen up in the pool area or Spa. To our surprise we were told that could have two adjacent rooms with a connecting door right now. After checking in we enjoyed a quite but sumptuous breakfast before being picked up for a desert safari at 90am.
Room was nice and big and bed was clean and soft. breakfast buffet was great. staff were really nice. but I do nt understand why local phone calls are being charged.

Comfortable stopover beside the sea close to airport and sights. Convenient for airport and Museum of Islamic Art and Souq. Good welcome and offered lo ew cost upgrade to suite on corner. Nice pool and polside bar restaurant. Pleasant hard working staff. Executive lounge happy hour with good views Good breakfast in main restaurant.

Excellent staff very accommodating very quiet very good price somewhat grotty rooms. The staff were really flexible and accommodating the rate was fantastic considering we got a 4 pm checkout and all day by the pool including an upgrade to a huge suite as well as breakfast for me and my kids. The hotel was generally old and run down. Stinks of smoke for non smokers all pretty standard in Doha. The general standards of 5 star accommodation is shocking for a city that boasts lots of shiny buildings and is building up to a world cup. Everywhere you go seems not to have been upgraded since it was built. However for the price fantastic deal. Would have no hesitation staying there again. Run down rooms and stank of cigarette smoke.

Very comfortable and the staff are excellent efficient and very helpful Very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent Indian restaurant. Superb breakfast. It was a bit further out from the centre than I expected but great if you want to run along the Corniche. Convenient for Souq Waqif and MIA.

Great choice in Doha. I stayed for 7 days at the Mariot Doha Hotel. From the moment of check in with the receptionist Hanah as well as the SPA pool and restaurants all staff were always very attentive. Thanks also to Mr Joe Cota responsible for the restaurants and always passing the tables greeting the guests and asking what they could help. In addition to the excellent breakfast the hotel has great restaurants especially JWs with meats and fish. Large room with a beautiful view of Doha bay with downtown in the background. Great gym pool and the hotel also has a small private beach. Close to major attractions in Doha Souq Waqif and National Museum of Qatar only 10 minutes by car. Excellent moments in Doha and also in this hotel.

The Doha Mariot Staff were lovely and the breakfast was yummy. There really was not anything that we did not like. The staff were lovely and very helpful and the airport pick up and drop off went really smoothly. The only thing that we did think was that the room was a little tired and could benefit from an update. All in all though we would stay there again.
